intro: Columnea mentiens, commonly known as the "whispering columnea," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular among horticulturists for its ornamental value. Columnea mentiens is also noted for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators with its nectar-rich blooms.
